intro: Rehmannia lutea, commonly known as the yellow rehmannia, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and fibrous roots. Its roots are the primary part used in traditional medicine, valued for their purported health benefits. Rehmannia lutea is also cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
